net.sf.mmm.search.indexer.impl.lucene

Class LuceneMutableSearchEntry

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.component.base.AbstractLoggableObject
      • net.sf.mmm.search.base.AbstractSearchEntry
        • net.sf.mmm.search.base.BasicSearchEntry
          • net.sf.mmm.search.indexer.base.AbstractMutableSearchEntry
            • net.sf.mmm.search.indexer.impl.lucene.LuceneMutableSearchEntry
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SearchEntry, MutableSearchEntry, AttributeReadId<Long>

    public class LuceneMutableSearchEntry
extends AbstractMutableSearchEntry
    This is the implementation of the MutableSearchEntry interface using lucene as underlying search-engine.
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

        Parameters:

      • setField

        public void setField(String name,
                     Object value)
        This method sets the field with the given name to the given value.
        It is forbidden to change the value of SearchEntry.FIELD_ID and doing so will cause an exception.
        For the supported types see SearchFieldType. Additionally Reader can be used to index large texts.
        ATTENTION:
        A value of the type Reader should only be used when indexing really large texts. In this case the mode has to be SearchFieldMode.SEARCHABLE and type has to be SearchFieldType.TEXT (NOT Reader). Further the Reader will only be closed when the MutableSearchEntry has been added or updated. If you never write the MutableSearchEntry to the index for some reason, you are responsible for closing the reader.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the field. E.g. SearchEntry.FIELD_TEXT.
        value - is the value of the field to set.

      • getFieldRaw

        protected Object getFieldRaw(String name)
        Specified by:
        getFieldRaw in class BasicSearchEntry
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the requested field.
        Returns:
        the raw value of the field as it is given by the underlying search technology.
        See Also:

      • getFieldNames
